intro: Neurocarpum laurifolium, commonly known as the laurel-leaf neurocarpum, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its evergreen foliage with shiny, oval leaves that resemble those of laurel. The plant produces small, white flowers that bloom in spring, followed by dark blue berries. It thrives in well-drained soils and partial shade, making it a suitable ornamental plant in gardens. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated for landscaping purposes.
